perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall produce the products described on Schedule A and Schedule A-1 attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the “Products,” each individual unit of Product “Unit”), for Premier at [***] Heritage’s or Heritage’s wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper’s facilities (the “Facilities”).
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage shall produce the goods described on Schedule A and Schedule A-1 attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the “Products,” each individual unit of Product “Unit”), for Premier at [***] Heritage’s or Heritage’s wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper’s facilities (the “Facilities”).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'products' to 'goods' introduces ambiguity. While 'products' typically refers to manufactured items, 'goods' is broader under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), potentially including raw materials or items not yet processed. This discrepancy could create disputes over what Heritage is obligated to produce and what Premier is obligated to accept.

perturbation.original_text: All Products manufactured, packaged and delivered by Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall conform to the specifications supplied to Heritage by Premier as listed on Schedule A and/or Schedule A-1, which Schedules may from time to time be modified by Premier in writing (the “Specifications”), shall conform to Post Holding’s Quality Expectations Manual attached hereto as Schedule E, and shall conform in all material respects to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage.
perturbation.changed_text: All deliverables created, packaged and delivered by Heritage or Jasper under the terms of this Agreement shall conform to the general guidelines provided to Heritage by Premier, which guidelines may from time to time be altered by Premier’s discretion (the “Specifications”), shall endeavor to align with Post Holding’s Quality Expectations Manual attached hereto as Schedule E, and shall attempt to conform in all practical aspects to samples previously supplied to Premier by Heritage.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing “Products” with “deliverables”, 'specifications' with 'general guidelines', 'modified in writing' with 'altered by Premier's discretion', 'shall conform' to 'endeavor to align with', and 'shall conform' to 'attempt to conform', weakens the obligation for Heritage to adhere to strict standards. 'Deliverables' is much broader and more vague than 'Products', and 'general guidelines' gives Premier more latitude in unilaterally changing the requirements without a written modification. The change from 'shall conform' to 'endeavor to align' makes the quality standards more aspirational than obligatory, which introduces uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - specifically relating to obligations and duties.

perturbation.original_text: Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***].
perturbation.changed_text: Heritage may procure some materials and packaging as it deems fit for creating items. Heritage will request payments from Premier in line with [***] billing as per the schedules. Heritage may purchase extra materials if it sees fit.
perturbation.explanation: By changing mandatory language ('shall purchase') to permissive language ('may procure'), the obligation for Heritage to provide certain materials is removed. Moreover, stating that Heritage 'may purchase extra materials' contradicts basic contract law because now the amount of materials Heritage procures is unbounded, in contradiction of the original text.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - relating to the enforcement of an agreement.
